text: what happens when what you see and what
do you think you see are two different
things
a door in the middle of a park a short
concrete wall and a remote control are
enough to create an illusion that gets
us questioning our reality people are
wondering where did the guy go I'm
wondering why is there a door in a park
this is really a wonderful little prank
this is a great example of how lazy our
brains are when we go through a door we
go in a straight line so we can conceive
because we've seen that pattern so many
times that someone will make a right
turn we see the obvious wall where the
man can hide and yet no one picks up on
that
I love the disappearing through the door
gag and truly tricked me
what you have here is an example of
cognitive dissonance that what you think
happened and what you saw happen do not
match and it creates this anxious
feeling because it doesn't make sense to
me I would have done the exact same
thing as many of these people did I
would have stood up I would have
researched it because I liked to be
tricked what takes place in this
experiment it's what's known as
psychological misdirection it's a
magician's best friend it's by diverting
your attention one way they can do a
sleight of hand the other way they may
think that person is gone like
disappeared from the face of the earth
and is in some other land right now
